snippet: India’s Supreme Court on Monday ordered lower courts to conclude the trials of lawmakers charged with grave crimes within a year of the date of the charges being filed as a way to reduce the number of politicians who are re-elected during drawn-out...
abstract: India's Supreme Court orders lower courts to conclude the trials of lawmakers charged with grave crimes within a year of the date of charges being filed; ruling is way to reduce number of politicians who are re-elected during drawn-out trials.
lead_paragraph: India’s Supreme Court on Monday ordered lower courts to conclude the trials of lawmakers charged with grave crimes within a year of the date of the charges being filed as a way to reduce the number of politicians who are re-elected during drawn-out trials.

headline.main: India’s Supreme Court Orders Speedier Trials for Lawmakers
